intro: Linaria variegata, commonly known as the variegated toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive variegated pattern. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Linaria variegata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
